intro: Hieracium orthopoides, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves and erect, hairy stems. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium orthopoides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
